conclusion: The v-t graph shows velocity as a function of time; velocity indicates speed and direction.
Positive velocity means movement in the positive direction; negative velocity means movement in the opposite direction.
Observe velocity values between t = 2 seconds and t = 3 seconds.
At t = 2 seconds, velocity is 0 m/s; at t = 3 seconds, velocity is -2 m/s.
Velocity is negative from 2 to 3 seconds, indicating motion opposite to the positive direction.
Velocity decreases from 0 m/s to -2 m/s, confirming motion in the negative direction.
The motion direction of the particle from 2 to 3 seconds is opposite to the defined positive direction.
